projects.name: Glass Shatter Transition
projects.description: Copies camera output to a glass surface, then shatters it & explodes, revealing the underlying scene. Similar to vfx in Super Smash Bros & Persona 5.

projects.name: Stencil Buffer Point Lights
projects.description: By writing a sphere volume where it intersects with geometry to the stencil buffer, we can use that as a mask to brighten pixels, creating a simple illusion of point lights in the style of Zelda: The Wind Waker.

projects.name: Artistic MipMap
description: Custom texture with different art for each MipMap level, and a simple shader to create the impression of water.
Using MipMaps to create explicit artistic effects by viewing distance, such as specularity or abstractions, is a powerful & performant tool.

projects.name: Toon Shader
projects.description: Custom Toon Shader for learning purposes with simple implementation of lambertian lighting thresholded by a color ramp texture, specular highlighting by viewing direction & light normal, rim lighting by view direction & surface normal, inverted hull outlines, and shadow casting.

projects.name: Dither by Distance
projects.description: Replicates transparency using dithering patterns and a mesh's distance from the camera for intensity, similar to effects in Super Mario Odyssey and Splatoon.

projects.name: Stripes
projects.description: Stripes drawn using UV tiling, UV displacement by time, toggable smoothstep falloff or harsh step, and sin wave warping.

projects.name: Vector Math & Shapes
description: Vector math examples for game development, including:
• Calculating the dot product of the player's look direction & direction towards the enemy with cone of view threshold
• Entity with a radial trigger based on distance between center points
Drawn using the Shapes library from Freya Holmer

projects.name: Recolor
projects.description: Finds the luminosity of a fragment and samples a 1D color texture to recolor it, very useful for things like player icons, player skins, color palettes, etc.
